intro: Hieracium macristolonum, commonly known as the Macristolon hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped. Hieracium macristolonum is often found in high-altitude environments where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
